name: Embassy Suites Dorado del Mar Beach & Golf Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We celebrated our 40th annivesary at the Embassy Suites Del Mar Beach and Golf Resort. We could not have been happier.
reviews.title: Our 40th Anniversary Stay was GREAT

reviews.text: Upon arrival the staff was courteous and helpful. In our room was a beautiful flower arrangement, wine, posters of welcome and congratulations on our 40th, a beautiful picture frame, and hearts on our bed.
reviews.title: Dining Options
Loved the Embassy Suites Dorado Del Mar!
reviews.text: We had a oceanview room on the 6th floor that had a beatutiful view. The pools and beach were wonderful.
We enjoyed the daily breakfast that was prepared as we asked and the manager's reception in the evening was great.
reviews.title: A very bad experience

likes.disliked: — the hotel staff and associated problems

reviews.text: While we were staying the Puerto Rico National Honor Society was having a convention. To find 200 or so very respectable young people who dressed very nicely and were very quite was reassuring to us of our younger generation.
reviews.title: Perfect Family Vacation

reviews.text: I stayed at this property for five nights for business.
reviews.title: This might be a nice hotel for vacation, but not great for business travelers

reviews.text: It is somewhat difficult to find the entry since the address does not appear in the GPS, and the map appears on the google map is incorrect. I highly recommend reviewing the direction to the hotel before setting out.
reviews.title: Fabulous Time!!

reviews.text: The bathroom relatively clean with a few mold spots on the celing. The chairs had lots of stains on it and looked dirty. The room was relatively quiet although it could get quite loud on Friday night when they bring in a band in the evening. The room stayed very cold no matter what I did to the thermostat.
reviews.title: Things you should know....

reviews.text: The internet connection was problematic. It does not allow VPN connection. I was disappointed in this since they charge for in-room wireless interent connection.
reviews.title: Just poor!

reviews.text: The food choices are not so great at the hotel, and I found parking to be very inconvenient and difficult.
reviews.title: Not up to Embassy Suites standards

likes.liked: — All the kids in the pool

reviews.title: Nice Family Friendly Location
reviews.text: This is our third trip to the Dorado area: one at the old Hyatt Dorado Beach (prior to children) and the last two at the Embassy Suites. As we have two your children (ages 30 months and 9 months), the Embassy Suites again lived up to our expectations. The family had a great time, as my sons loved the pool area and the abundance of other kids.

Transportation: As this location is 45 minutes from San Juan without traffic, I would highly recommend renting a car. Also, the restaurants in the hotel are somewhat limited so it allows freedom of choice for dining options. There are major roadways that resemble the US road and street system. The symbols are the same but the language is in Spanish. The speed limits are posted in Miles but everything else follows the metric system. If you can drive in NY, Boston, or Philadelphia rush hour traffic you will be ok on the roads.
reviews.title: Nice place in Dorado

likes.liked: — The hotel was close to where our friends live.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: Dorado is a sleepy ocean town without much nightlife and no casinos at this time. The hotel is in a gated community in the middle of a golf course.
reviews.title: I Can't Wait to go back!

likes.liked: — Pool and sunshine, friendly staff, room

reviews.text: Hotel Facilities: Standard Embassy suites room with added bonus of balcony. We were thankfully upgraded to ocean front/view room on top room that had a great view of the small beach and medium sized pool area (pool side bar, restaurant, playground, baby pool, and numerous lounge chairs). The gym is outfitted with new Precor? equipment and does focus on the aerobic stuff with limited barbells. Also, there is a game room and coin laundry in lower level area. The beach is small but really hotel use only as access to the area is limited. The beach is protected but does get rocky about 10 or 15 ft out from shore.
reviews.title: wasted money, vacation...misleading information - awful

likes.disliked: — everything else- room size, smell, heat/ac leaks, food expensive, gift shop expensive meds stuff - ...everything

reviews.text: Extras: Happy hour 5:30 to 7:30 and free breakfast is a great touch. The breakfast is a great bonus with youngsters. The
reviews.title: Awesome Place - Great Service- Will stay again and again.

reviews.text: We stayed four nights at the resort. It was a very beautiful property with a lot to offer. While I wasn't able to enjoy any golf during this trip, the course itself looked great. The private beach area is very nice, and the pool area is fantastic. The room was large and the included hot breakfast buffett in the morning was good.
reviews.title: Very nice resort in Dorado, PR

likes.liked: — Very nice pool and beach area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful and peaceful. The pool is very big although it was often full of kids. The beach is lovely and there are plenty of beach chairs for every one. The hotel lobby is typical Embassy Suites. The location is far from the hubub of San Juan which can be nice but really leaves you with only a few options for activity unless you want to deal with traffic and waste a good bit of time in your car. Also very limited choice of restaurants and no real shopping in the area. Great golf course though. The hotel has a three restaurants, one closes at 5:00pm, one isn't open on Mondays and Tuesdays, one has a pretty average menu--good but nothing to get excited about. There used to be some casinos in Dorado but they have long since closed--despite what some websites and guide books may tell you. If you stay here you will need a car or really want to just get away from everything.
reviews.title: beautiful location

reviews.text: We were there for 2 weeks in August and they were still filming the Chilean soap opera! Maybe it goes on forever! It was fun watching them set up the scenes and it did not interfere at all with our stay.
reviews.title: Loved this place, would go back tomorrow

likes.disliked: — Must have own car to get to anywhere, no organized tours or groups picked up for day trips.

reviews.text: Lovely hotel, and the choices for restaurants in Dorado go on and on. We were a group of 7 and ate at a different place downtown every night. All restaurants in town were excellent offering the freshest seafood. Breakfast at Dorado is great, lunch by the pool is OK, dinner, eh, could do much better, go elsewhere. I don't golf, but the golf course is lovely and full of iquanas and birds. There is plenty resort area to walk around and see, they have children's activities and everyone is friendly. Only swim in the marked areas, or sea urchins can be underfoot. Bring your snorkel and some fish food to sprinkle and fish will swim all around you.
reviews.title: Good family value

reviews.text: My only quibble is the location of the massage room -- they have tiny room stuck in the basement in the back of the icey, cold fitness room. The Embassy suites could surely afford to create a small spa area upstairs where you could soak and have a sunlit massage. It just seems cheesy to go for a massage in a dingy basement next to an underground garage & noisy game room. Come on, Embassy Suites, get with the Spa scene!
reviews.title: Dorado Beach Hotel

aka: Embassy Suites Dorado Del Mar Beach & Golf Hotel Dorado
description: The only all suite beachfront Resort in Puerto Rico offering a relaxed tropical atmosphere with a three form lagoon pool overlooking the Atlantic Ocean. A perfect setting for families offering a two room suite, a daily complimentary cooked to order breakfast and two hours at our evening reception daily. Recreational facilities include an 18-hole par-72 Chi Chi Rodriguez signature golf course, a Fitness center, game room, Laundromat, a new Casino and much more.
